So at the end of the day, the pathway to safety has become both extremely narrow (11 out of 1200) and “challenging.” And standing across that pathway is the fossil fuel industry’s continuing and persistent campaign of denial and obstruction.

That leaves only 26 out of 1200 scenarios. Scientists put them into three likelihoods: zero were deemed “reasonable” to attain, 11 were put in the “challenging” category, and the remainder were deemed “speculative” to achieve.

Of those 112, 86 have “high overshoots” into high temperature scenarios before reverting back to 1.5 degrees Celsius, which creates dangerous risks during that overshoot of tipping points, collapses and cascades.
Of those 230, only 112 were still technically possible to achieve.
Of those 1200 outcomes, only 230 get us to safe levels of warming below the generally accepted (but not risk-free) level of 1.5 degrees Celsius.
